messages: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:36): HTML parsing pop quiz:
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:37): <script>document.write("<plaintext>Filler"); document.close()</script>
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:38): What does the DOM look like after document.close?
4626ff063cc727dfcf6d3044c7c17ee5 (11:38): broken?
4626ff063cc727dfcf6d3044c7c17ee5 (11:38): does broken count? :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (11:39): Is it not just <plaintext>Filler?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:39): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: The theory is that it is not
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:40): The theory might be wrong :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:45): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: <html><head></head><body><plaintext>Filler</plaintext></body></html>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:45): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: (I didn't cheat. That is, I didn't actually try running your snippet.)
8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21 (11:48): seems like that would still be in the dom
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (11:48): Well, yeah. But I'm not convinced that's the interesting part. :P
8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21 (11:49): i'm not sure whether we've properly handled all the document.close() cases
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:49): oh. I misread. I though the calling code was outside the document itself given .close()
8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21 (11:49): especially with synchronous script execution with nested insertion points
8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21 (11:50): exactly how synchronous it is is tricky
8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21 (11:50): but this isn't one of those cases
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:01): The theory is that the document.close() does nothing and, at the point it is called there is no <plaintext> in the DOM because EOF has not yet been reached
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:03): (If this theory is true the results of nesting the whole construct inside a document.write of its own would be interestingly different)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:21): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: why wouldn't both the plaintext element and its child text node be already in the DOM at the point of calling .close()?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:21): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I thought the spec changed to require that
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:22): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I expect it's even tested on html5test.com
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: The theory could be wong, like I said, but I thought it only got emitted on EOF
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:25): Oh, no, that seems right
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:26): OK, so the original case I was looking at is more complex
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:26): Maybe the more complex is needed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:26): goes spec hunting
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:28): Right, I oversimplified
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:29): More thinking less typing
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:32): <script>document.write("<table><plaintext>Filler"); document.close()</script> was the original case
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:32): more or less
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:33): And in this case at the point of document.close the dom should have the <plaintext>, the <table> but *not* the string "Filler"
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:40): http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/saved/673
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:43): <table> is a neat way to make some content load later but appear earlier in the dom
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:43): too bad it's invalid to do that :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:46): Where "neat" in this case mean "non-interoperable and weird"
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:48): it'll soon be interoperable
34a58f4db427de1e268283ef4329f6a1 (12:53): http://addons.labs.opera.com/addons/extensions/
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:53): hmm, wonder why the background and canvas examples don't work in opera in http://blog.dholbert.org/2010/10/svg-as-image.html
34a58f4db427de1e268283ef4329f6a1 (12:53): wrong channel
